main event: On March 24, 1966, two witnesses observed a bright light in the sky over Sheboygan, Wisconsin, which exhibited unusual movements, including hovering and splitting into two objects.
interesting points: The sighting lasted approximately 15 to 20 minutes., The object was described as a bright light, much brighter than any star., During the sighting, the object appeared to split into two before rejoining., Witnesses felt a sense of urgency to report the event due to its peculiar nature., The object was estimated to be about 20 to 30 feet in diameter and made no audible sound.
sighted object: a bright light in the sky
witness description: The witnesses reported the light as bright, hovering, and capable of unusual maneuvers.
